author: paperliss
content: I'm working on a project that is going to need a payment scaling solution. It involves 3rd parties collecting payment recites off-chain and then posting them in batches on-chain. I have yet to find great libraries for using STARK's in a blockchain context. Is there a good resource someone could point me to for this? Or should I be looking into plasma instead?

author: sky.cactus
content: I recommend looking into some of the ZK Rollups that are under development.  While none of them are (IMO) worthy of being called L2s yet (as they all are permissioned/trusted), the underlying tech behind them is quite sound.

author: sky.cactus
content: Some search terms: StarkWare, Cairo, Aztec, Circom, zkSync

author: lapdo
content: Hey everyone, I have recently started writing my MSc thesis on the Quantum Threat and Ethereum, but currently i am still writing my research proposal. I will be analysing the current cryptography methods that are used in Eth and see how one would be able to make the network quantum-safe by integrating the appropriate post-quantum cryptography methods (e.g. the four finalists announced by NIST and potential other ones that are relevant). After this, i will look at technological barriers for implementation (compatibility, trade-offs etc.), while also looking into organisational obstacles (soft/hard fork). Is there anyone in here that can give me some advice/guidance on this particular topic. Thank you very much!!

author: lapdo
content: I am sorry, I just donâ€™t know which specific server to post this.

author: lapdo
content: I initially presumed to post in here, but after searching ctrl f, I found that the topic of post quantum cryptography was mentioned in multiple servers, hence my action.
